content.description: Climb to the large ledge and then follow the crack in the left facing corner to chains.  A direct start on the crack to gain the ledge is 5.9.
content.protection: Small- to mid-sized cams and nuts. Easiest if you have triples of certain sizes - or else get creative!  Anchors with chains.
content.location: 2nd established climb on the wall, towards the left side.

content.description: Scramble up the left side of the alcove, and follow the crack in the corner to the top.
content.protection: Slings around a tree, nuts or cams in the crack, and bolts on top.
content.location: Walk up the trail and look for a big alcove with an aspen tree behind a flake. A trail on the left side of the cliff leads to the top of the cliff. From here, set up a toprope with long runners if desired.

content.description: Start in an alcove below the right-arching crack and above a steep overhang.  The start is tough to protect without terrible rope drag.  Once you make it to the ledges though, you have nasty, dirty climbing to look forward to!  Bon Appetit to your belayer.
content.location:
This is the corner left of

Popsicle

.

content.description: The namesake route for the Finger Food Wall, this is the finger crack at the far left. Climb the crack with a hard move at the top. Move right--there is a good cam here, but it would be hard to hang out--and make an awkward move onto the ramp above. Move left with no gear to easy ground.
content.protection: Small to medium cams. It has a bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the finger crack at the far left.

content.description: This is excellent as a first trad lead.  It climbs funny crack(s) on a prominent prow.
content.protection: Mid-sized cams work best.  Run out the low angle top section for extra fun!  2 bolt top anchors but no rap rings.
content.location: This is the 5th and right-most established climb on Fast Food Wall.  You can't miss it!
